google_play_reviews.content: This is the most useful app, it's just the right way to go when you need a reliable alert system, thanks for the great work!!!
Excellent app. Feature request: allow scaling the message list text to make bigger or smaller font size. Would also be useful to have option to accept self signed https certs. Great work 游녨
Incredibly well designed and well documented, rock solid and reliable, simple and easy to use, minimal impact on both server and clients. Out of this world.
Experience is great. But battery usage is unacceptable. Roughly 20% over a whole day when not optimised.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Stefan, I'm sorry you didn't have a great experience with the battery. However, I'd like to point out that 99% of ntfy users have no issues with the battery. Certain phone manufacturers are extremely bad at managing battery life, so that's likely what is happening here. Fairfone in particular has a tremendously terrible track record.

google_play_reviews.content: The application is great. Wish it had a way to accept self signed certificates. Externally my site uses a cloudflare certificate, but internally uses a self signed cert and the ntfy app cannot connect when connected to internal wifi.
Love this app for integrating to my home automation and for work scripts. Only wish i found it sooner
User friendly. Easy to use, and configure. Doesn't take long to launch and very light weight
Simple and super useful at the same time
No way to synchronize subscriptions between devices, meaning that e-mail and Atom generally remain superior.
Awesome pice of software, all the junk email notifications are now pushed to users and no longer takes up space in the mailbox. keep up good work
Works as intended. Thank you Mr Developer for writing code while we sleep
Excellent tools for self hosted folks to use notifications without the pain of having to have webhooks... etc.....

There are not many apps that do one thing and excel at it (in this case do a lot and excel at all of them). Ntfy is basically install and forget and it just works with zero intervention required. I can't imagine not using it anymore.
Amazing!
great push notifications app
best custom push ever

google_play_reviews.replyContent: I'm sorry you couldn't get it to work. Feel free to drop by the Discord or Matrix chats and ask for help there. I'm sure why can get it working together.

google_play_reviews.content: Awesome, way better than any other notification system I have tried.

Amazing project and fantastic app. Great pub/sub notification system. Well thought out and good docs. Thank you Philipp and wow following your comment I checked about the per subscription customisations which are fantastic. Unfortunately Android 13 only seems to let you allow an app in DND mode, its all or nothing. Would it be possible to have a simple schedule that only allows selected subscrtions to alert during a definable window? That works be icing on the cake :)
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can change the notification settings per subscription. Go to the topic detail screen, then "Subscription settings", and then enable "Custom notification settings". Then you can configure sounds, DND for this one subscription.

google_play_reviews.content: Works as advertised. I have a self hosted ntfy server and the whole setup was all done in 10min. Thank you devs.
perfect

Awesome tool to allow me to do stuff while I am doin stuff
Brilliant!
Best app if you know how to use it well

I love the app but can you please remove the persistent notification. (Listening for incoming notifications), Edit: Thanks for the reply. Would you please add the ability to choose custom icons for different subscriptions
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
You can remove that yourself! It is required in Android to remind people that something in the background is running that consumes battery. There's a description of how to do it here: https://docs.ntfy.sh/subscribe/phone/#instant-delivery

Edit: custom icons per subscriptions are also supported in Android in the subscription settings.

google_play_reviews.content: Wow, super duper useful thank u creator.

This app seamlessly work. Kudos to the developer.

This is, by far, the best app I've found to seamlessly send notifications to my phone from nearly anything, including Home Assistant, Node-RED, random shell scripts, healthchecks.io; anything that can publish to webhooks. It's fully open source; you can even host the server yourself. There are some minor limits with the free tier, but they are *very* reasonable (250 notifications/day), and only apply to the official instance.

Simple and extremely useful.
It's exactly what I was looking for. I tried a self hosting with docker and works smooth. Great job!

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your fantastic review. I am more than happy to help troubleshoot and answer questions on Discord/Matrix if you like. You'll find links on the bottom of the website, or on GitHub.

google_play_reviews.content: Exactly what I was looking for and works great. Thank you for doing this!
Small, fast and efficient. This plus a JSON viewer to decode uploaded details, and I'm moving most of my remote logging framework to ntfy.

Flawless

Wonderful! Self-hosting on Docker and it works great. I just wish there would be a way to make the permanent notification disappear or less visible, but that's Android policy. A step more towards my cloud-dependency free life! Edit: thanks for the quick reply. I did not use this because it prevents instant delivery, or did I misunderstand the documentation?
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks for the kind words. You can hide the permanent notification pretty easily. There is a description in the docs: https://docs.ntfy.sh/subscribe/phone/#instant-delivery

Edit: It doesn't prevent instant delivery. We chat chat further on Discord or Matrix.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: That's a pretty brutal review. ntfy does have a full auth framework and does work with password protected topics. I'm happy to help troubleshoot on Discord or Matrix, if you like. I also welcome you to create a feature request on GitHub if something is missing.

google_play_reviews.content: This is fantastic for small projects where it isn't worth writing an app for it. Thank you so much for putting this together and hosting it!

Just tried the android app and love it. Always wanted an easy way for sending stuff to my phone. Adding Tasker plugin support to trigger tasks from topics would be really great and helpful to lot of folks!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the kind words. You can already integrate with Tasker and MacroDroid via intents. See examples here: https://ntfy.sh/docs/subscribe/phone/#automation-apps

google_play_reviews.content: Brilliant and simple. Took me 5 minutes to set up

This app is excellent I haven't had one single problem I can allow my friends to send me a notification just through a link which is very cool however maybe a feature that could be added is like rate limit like how much notifications you can get in a specific time like 1 every 10 mins and it blocks all other requests until the cooldown is over
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Thank you for the feedback. .

You can in fact control the rate limiting logic if you self host your server. Here's a detailed section in the docs: https://ntfy.sh/docs/config/#rate-limiting
